required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Grip Endurance, Disability of Upper Extremity and Quality of Life in Patients With RA
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Relationship Between Grip Endurance, Disability of Upper Extremity and Quality of Life in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the relationship between grip endurance, disability of upper extremity and quality of life in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: Upper extremity functions affect the quality of life at different levels in patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). In the current literature; it has been shown that grip endurance is associated with upper limb functions. However, there is no study investigating the relationship between grip endurance and quality of life in patients with RA. The purpose of this study is to investigate the relationship between grip endurance, disability of upper extremity, and quality of life in patients with RA.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data collection will continue until December 2019. Data analysis and report preparation will be completed by September 2020.
primary_outcome.description: Static grip endurance was evaluated by Hand Dynamometer (Lafayette Proffessional Hand Dynamometer, USA). The maximum gripping time of 50% of the maximum grip force was recorded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Data collection will continue until December 2019. Data analysis and report preparation will be completed by September 2020.
primary_outcome.description: Dynamic grip endurance was evaluated by Hand Dynamometer (Lafayette Proffessional Hand Dynamometer, USA). The percentage change between the first 3 grips and the last 3 grips after 10 consecutive grips is recorded.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Data collection will continue until December 2019. Data analysis and report preparation will be completed by September 2020.
secondary_outcome.description: This parameter was evaluated by Disability of Arm, Shoulder and Hand (DASH) questionairre.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Data collection will continue until December 2019. Data analysis and report preparation will be completed by September 2020.
secondary_outcome.description: This parameter was evaluated by Short Form-36.

study_pop.textblock: The population of the study consists of RA patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- RA patients were classified according to the ACR 2010 criteria.
- taking regular medication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- having a history of trauma or surgery in the upper limb.
- having neurological, cognitive, or psychiatric diseases.

overall_official.affiliation: İzmir Katip Celebi University, Faculty of Health Sciences

clinical_study.keyword: Grip Endurance, DASH, Quality of Life, Rheumatoid Arthritis.
